tornado 0.1.1
  • Reference

    GLMNET Tornado Diagram

    tornado.cv.glmnet.Rd

    GLMNET Tornado Diagram

    # S3 method for cv.glmnet
tornado(
  model,
  modeldata,
  form,
  s = "lambda.1se",
  type = "PercentChange",
  alpha = 0.1,
  alt.order = NA,
  dict = NA,
  xlabel = "Response Rate",
  ...
)

    Arguments

    model

    a cv.glmnet object

    modeldata

    the raw data used to fit the glmnet model

    form

    the model formula

    s

    Value(s) of the penalty parameter lambda at which predictions are required. Default is the value s="lambda.1se" stored on the CV object. Alternatively s="lambda.min" can be used. If s is numeric, it is taken as the value(s) of lambda to be used.

    type

    PercentChange, percentiles, or ranges

    alpha

    the level of change

    alt.order

    an alternate order for the plot

    dict

    a dictionary to translate variables for the plot

    xlabel

    a label for the x-axis

    ...

    further arugments

    Value

    the plot

    Examples

    if (requireNamespace("glmnet", quietly = TRUE))
{
  mf <- model.frame(mpg ~ cyl*wt*hp, data=mtcars)
  mm <- model.matrix(mf, mf)
  gtest <- glmnet::cv.glmnet(x = mm, y= mtcars$mpg, family = "gaussian")
  tornado(gtest, mtcars, formula(mpg ~ cyl*wt*hp), s="lambda.1se",
          type = "PercentChange", alpha = 0.10, xlabel = "MPG")
}
